div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to J. F. Siler, September 7, 1927
div1.opener:

COL. FREDERICK H. VINUP
MEDICAL CORPS, MARYLAND NATIONAL GUARD

SENIOR SURGEON C. H. LAVINDER
UNITED STATES PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
ADDRESS ALL COMMUNICATIONS TO
THE MILITARY SURGEON
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM
SEVENTH AND B STS. S. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
THIRD VICE-PRESIDENT
BRIGADIER GENERAL WM. H. WILMER
MEDICAL RESERVE CORPS, UNITED STATES ARMY
FOURTH VICE-PRESIDENT
CAPT. JAMES C. PRYOR
MEDICAL CORPS, UNITED STATES NAVY
EDITOR AND SECRETARY-TREASURER
COL. JEFFERSON R. KEAN
UNITED STATES ARMY, RET.
7 September, 1927.
My dear Siler;
div1.p:
I am sending back your letter from Russell which
I was very glad of the opportunity to see and with it am
sending a copy of a letter that I wrote to Dr. Jorge LeRoy,
the statistician of the Cuban Health Department. I have no
doubt that Russell is right that it is a waste of time to
enter into any argument with the Cubans and I have written
this letter rather to get it off my chest than because I
anticipate that it will do any good. I am anxious for
them to see that we do not want to steal anything from Dr.
Finlay who was a dear old man. At the same time I was
glad of an excuse to get across to them Goldberger's very
neat epigramatic statement “Reed converted a discredited
theory into an established doctrine”.
Please return my letter as it is my only copy.
div1.closer:
With best wishes,
Sincerely yours, J.R. Kean J. R. KEAN
Colonel, U.S. Army, Retired
Editor.
